physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Increased calf volume associated with upslanting toenails and moderately increased thickness of the dorsal face of the second toe (Stemmer's sign). Pitting edema on the anterior faces of the lower legs, especially on the right side. Lymphedema involved the ankle, including the retromalleolar space. No distichiasis or other clinical symptoms present.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially intermittent lower limb edema that regressed during cold periods has evolved to persistent bilateral edema predominantly affecting the right lower limb following surgical intervention for hydrocele.
